Public Project

Stay tuned, more will follow

  1. Git Automate
    - As every other developer, I too love Rust but I had one small problem. I didn't know Rust lang. So I decided to learn Rust by building small project such as Git Automate. This CLI tool basically shorten three git commands to one
  2. Anime Vault
    - Being huge anime fan always wanted to build an anime website. When Next.js launched server action, I finally decided to build one. I used typescript, server action and tailwind. I used an free API and implemented infinte scroll
  3. Kaboom.js Example
    - Angry Cheeku is a fun and addictive game inspired by the classic Flappy Bird, developed using Kaboom.js. In this game, players control Cheeku, a cute and feisty little cat, as they navigate through a series of obstacles in the form of branches. The objective is simple: keep Cheeku flying (I know cat's don't fly) for as long as possible while avoiding collisions with the pillars
  4. Event Website Template
    - Having to built a website for small university events is an struggle. I decided to build an Template using Next.js, Tailwind. The template was orignally built for
    MustCon'24

Hobbies

I enjoy watching anime 🎬, gaming 🎮, reading books on history 📚, philosophy 🧠, and personal development 📈. Recently, I've started going to the gym 💪 and I also enjoy sports like football ⚽, cricket 🏏, and badminton 🏸. Additionally, I like building small DIY projects in electronics, robotics 🤖, or tools using my tech skills 💡. Both reading and sports help me maintain a good work/life balance ⚖️, which is essential when working in IT 💻. Globally, I'm always keen to learn and find ways to further improve my skills and workflows 🌍, whether in my hobbies or at work.
